Does every graph on $n$ vertices with $>\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)$ edges contain $\gg n^{1/2}$ many copies of $C_4$?



Conjectured by Erd\H{o}s and Simonovits, who could not even prove that at least $2$ copies of $C_4$ are guaranteed.

The behaviour of $\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)$ is the subject of [765].

He, Ma, and Yang \cite{HeMaYa21} have proved this conjecture when $n=q^2+q+1$ for some even integer $q$.




References


[HeMaYa21] He, J. and Ma, J. and Yang, T., Some extremal results on 4-cycles. Journal of Combinatorial Theory B (2021).
